conclusion: Analyze the motion of the bullets and the carts.
Cart A is moving to the left with speed v1.
Cart B is moving to the right with speed v2.
Bullets are fired with a speed v0 relative to the ground.
Bullets are fired every Δt0 time interval.
Each bullet hits the target on Cart B when the next bullet is fired.
The speed of the bullets relative to Cart A is v0 + v1.
The speed of the bullets relative to Cart B is v0 - v2.
The time it takes for a bullet to hit Cart B is the same as the time interval between firing bullets, Δt0.
The distance s between two adjacent bullets in the air is given by the relative speed of the bullets multiplied by the time interval Δt0.
The relative speed of the bullets with respect to the ground is v0 + v1.
The distance s is then: s = (v0 + v1) Δt0.
The distance s between two adjacent bullets in the air is determined by the speed of the bullets relative to Cart A and the firing interval.
The distance s between two adjacent bullets in the air is given by: s = (v0 + v1) Δt0.
